description: "Tempest Fugit" Part 1 of 5. Stalking across the depths of the ocean, dispatching everything from sharks to giant squids, comes the Hulk. As a long-buried episode from Bruce Banner's youth begins to surface with possible ramifications for the future, the Hulk finds himself washed up on a strange island, populated by several hapless victims... and some most unexpected monsters.
name: Tempest Fugit, Part 1 of 5

description:
After a hard day of fighting evil mutants, Sentinels, and whatnot, Logan finally gets a chance to spend a day with his foster daughter Amiko, who wants to waste it looking at art. 
 
He finally convinces her to let him take her to the carnival instead, but while there he's enraged by a crowd making fun of him, loses his temper, and takes it out on Amiko - physically. Now he must deal with the aftermath of his anger, and the possible loss it may have brought him.
name: Part 1 of 5

description:
This issue contains four stories.  The back cover is a pin-up of Cloak and Dagger.
 
"Reflections" - Ben Grimm, the Thing, piloting an experimental spacecraft, crash lands on a South Pacific island where the natives wonder is he is the prophesized "Promised One".  When he comes to, Ben is blinded and has no memory of who he is, but he aids the natives any way he can, building structures and damming the river.  As he works, he learns his companions believe he was sent by Kelmak, a king from their recent past. 
Later, after Ben rescues a boy from a fall into the river, his sight and memory return.  Seeing his monstrous reflection in the water's surface, he goes into a brief rage, but calms down when he sees the faces of the people that have accepted him among them.  Soon, he is shown the journal of Lt. Kelly McCormack, who went native after World War II, becoming the king, Kelmak.  Then, having finally located Ben, the rest of the Fantastic Four arrive to collect him. 
 
"So Near" - For years, the Man-Thing stands immobile in a Louisiana bayou, as events occasionally unfold near him: several members of a reclusive clan who are deaf and mute are pursued and shot at by gun-toting rednecks; the lone survivor of the group, a woman, is raped by the gang; afterwards, she approaches the Man-Thing, and is somewhat comforted, despite her anguish at feeling the child conceived within her.  Seven years later, a high school couple, a black boy and a white girl, run out of gas as they run away from home; continuing on foot, they near the Man-Thing when a lightning bolt hits a nearby tree; they reconsider their decision and decide to return home.  Six years later, the rednecks return and the drown they remaining members of the clan, including the woman they raped years before, forcing her daughter to watch.  The girl slips into the swamp, and when her captors chase after her, they are assaulted and killed by the vegetation which seems to have come to life.  The girl approaches the Man-Thing to thank him.  Three months later, feeling a tremendous wave of fear from the victims of a massive earthquake in Japan, the Man-Thing finally moves.
 
Untitled - Dr. Strange narrates this tale, describing his roles, responsibilities and challenges as this dimension's Sorceror Supreme.  He enters a mystic realm where he faces a shapeshifting demon near a bizarre floating structure.  Strange keeps the entity at bay long enough to allow the emergence from the structure of a giant butterfly-like being. 
 
"The Date" - Peter Parker rushes through the halls of Midtown High School, and has to turn down a surprising invitation from Liz Allen to join "the gang" at the malt shop.  He hurries out to try to get to a previous engagement, changing into his Spider-Man suit to expedite matters.  On the way, however, he is impelled to stop to aid an elderly lady who's been mugged, and to stop a bank robbery by the Rhino. 
Running late, he finally makes it home where his Aunt May awaits.  Soon, they make it to a visit at the grave of his Uncle Ben, where May assures Peter that, wherever he is, Ben is proud of his nephew.
name: Reflactions & other stories

description:
This issue contains four stories. There are also six pin-ups of various characters.

"Where Will All Come Home" - Bruce Banner explores the submerged vault where he long ago kept the Hulk at bay during his nightly transformations. As he ponders his dual existence, an earthquake causes part of the chamber to collapse, forcing Banner into the containment vault. Now trapped and running out of air, he allows himself to become the Hulk. Stronger now than he was years ago, the Hulk breaks out. Calming down, he reverts to Banner, who reflects on his unbreakable link to the monster.

"...Even the Beast Hates" - Jack Russell is in the Catskills to allow the Werewolf to let loose under the full moon. As he roams, he comes across the remains of a young boy who has been savagely murdered. The next morning, in the nearby town of Wharton, Jack stakes out the elementary school, till he spots a suspicious person. He recognizes the man's scent from the murder scene and approaches him, claiming to be a kindred spirit. Jack offers a risk-free opportunity to indulge in his perversion if he'll meet him at the Black Creek Motel that evening.

The killer does show up at Jack's room, but before long, it becomes evident to him that Jack is not what he claimed. The moon rises and Jack becomes the Werewolf. The killer runs from the motel room and through the town, the Werewolf close on his heels. The chase leads into the woods, where the killer soon finds himself cornered on a cliff. As the lycanthrope closes in, the ledge crumbles beneath the killer's feet, and he falls to his death.

"Foul Tip" - Acting on a tip, Spider-Man looks for an abandoned warehouse where some criminal activity transpires. He soon finds members of A.I.M. in a building where they construct a device of some sort. Spidey goes into action, clobbering the terrorist agents and their "Cyber-Sentinel", destroying the device in the process. Spider-Man then questions one of the thugs, asking where to find their employer, Dr. Octopus. Confused, the A.I.M. agent says they were hired by the Viper, and Spidey realizes he had the wrong address.

Untitled - A warship comes out of hyperspace near the Silver Surfer, who is surveying a war-torn planet for his master, Galactus. The ship opens fire on the Surfer, who replies with a blast of cosmic power. The Surfer then confronts the sole inhabitant of the ship, an explorer named Skarrzz, who begs the Surfer not to summon Galactus until he can lure his own master to this planet. He further explains his master, Kallreich is a merciless conqueror of worlds who accepted Skarrzz's services finding new worlds to conquer, in exchange for sparing Skarrzz's own planet. But now, the guilt-ridden Skarrzz desires only that he and Kallreich be destroyed by Galactus.

The Surfer, above such petty concerns, refuses and leaves to summon the world-devourer. However, the Surfer, seeing parallels in Skarrzz's tale to his own life, reconsiders. Shortly after Kallreich arrives to punish Skarrzz for brining him to a lifeless world, Galactus consumes the planet.

Pin-ups are of Colossus, Thor, Silver Samurai and Viper, the X-Men (Wolverine, Rogue and Nightcrawler) vs. the Brood, Thing and Alicia Masters, and Nick Fury.
name: Where All Will Come Home & other stories

description: During the Cold War, the Russians were experimenting with creating the perfect covert weapon... a blend of strength, speed, killing power, stealth, and the human body. Project "Adrenalynn" was born. After sending many of these prototypes to the US for terrorist plots, they were ordered to shut themselves down and await retrieval. However, due to their extended inactivity, they began to "mutate" into half-monster, half-machine and are on the rampage! Sabina Nikoli (an unassuming teenage girl), is a better developed version of the project sent out on a search and destroy mission. The only problem is that when the job's done, the Russian organization that created her wants her dead as well! Featured in the pages of The Tenth, Adrenalynn is a Russian-built war machine, designed for speed and destruction. She jumps into her own series with a bang and is sure to leave fans wanting more!!! From F5 Entertainment and Image Comics.

After hiding Adrenalynn from the Russians who made her, Yuri decides to put Addie into action against the remaining Russian monster androids! This means big bucks for Yuri, but at what cost when his new weapon is an innocent teenage killing machine? We also get further into Adrenalynn's past when she was just an orphaned handicapped girl living during the Cold War in Russia's most neglected children's orphanage. Mega monster-robot action vs. the teenage and superiorly-built Adrenalynn--will brute strength win out against agility and precision?? Find out when Addie battles Ciron, in the second issue of what's sure to be the sensation of the Summer!

Sabina hunts down the last two Monster-cyborgs from Russia, with the hope that Yuri will give her the key to her humanity. Sabina, a Russian -built cold war weapon was programmed to destroy the evidence of more ex-cold war weapons hiding in America! When her job is done....so is she as far as her builders are concerned! But Yuri is starting to realize that there's more to Sabina than nuts and bolts....there's a real life person under all that weaponry. Things get sticky in this issue, so be sure not to miss it!

Guns are blazing in this action packed climax! We finally see the "real" Sabina for who she WAS not WHAT she IS! The Russians that built her will stop at nothing to destroy the evidence that became ADRENALYNN....even if it means annihilating an entire city! With stunning artwork by Marty Egeland, who is said to be doing the best work of his career right here in these pages, and a story that will keep you on the edge of your seats by Tony Daniel and awesome colors to compliment, you won't want to miss this one!

After a year of the brutal murder of Eric Draven and his fiancee Shelly Webster, a mystical crow revives Eric to avenge against those who ended his life, so he can finally rest in peace. Draven comes to Gideon's pawn shop in search of the people who killed him and his girlfriend. Eric kills Gideon for having accepted Shelly´s engagement ring and goes looking for Tin-Tin, a two-bit thug who pawned the ring. Draven shows Tin-Tin the darkness he has wrought and then takes his life.
name: Resurrection

description: Eric Draven continues his revenge. T-Bird, one of Top-Dollar's thugs ends up in the morgue minus his head. Meanwhile, the detectives track down Skank, another member of the group. During his interrogation on a dark stairwell, a bloody head topples down the stairs. It is the head of T-Bird. Draven finds himself in the company of Funboy, Darla and Sarah. Funboy ultimately joins his friends on the obituary page.
name: Death

description: Draven listens intently to the cassette tape Sarah had given him earlier. On it, Shelly recounts her beautiful day and all of the plans she & Eric have together. All the while he listens to the tape, the horrific murder scene is played over and over in his mind. After offing Skank while in protective custody, he ends up at The Blackout, Top-Dollar's hangout. The police are already there to make an arrest, but Draven takes care of them in his own way.
name: Shadows

description: Now that Eric Draven has avenged his death why is he still the Crow? The Crow finds himself involved in the life of his young friend, Sarah, and her family.
name: The Line Between The Devil's Teeth
In The Skin Of An Angel I

description: After two teenagers find the death body of a little girl, Eric Draven gets involved to find the killer. Detective Albrecht´s son, Marcus, is arrested for the crime. Although the evidence against him is mounting, Eric is convinced of his innocence. The Crow informs Eric about the virus that causes evil in the world; a virus that lays dormant until its host unleashed it in a moment of rage and violence. There is no cure, but the Bird suggest that there is the possibility of limiting its spread.
name: Touch of Evil I

description: El Tiburón, a loan shark who gets sadistic pleasure in torturing clients delinquent in repaying him, is visited by The Crow, who sees him as a carrier of a new strain of the virus that causes evil. While at El Tiburón´s, The Crow is attacked by the Skull Cowboy, who suggests the bird´s motives and the truthfulness of its teachings may not be what they seem. When The Crow asks the bird about the Skull Cowboy, the discussion is interrupted by a feeling that something is wrong. The crow rushes off to the cementery to find Shelly´s body has been desinterred, and a dead police officer lies next to the empty grave.
name: Ashes to Ashes I

description: In a future war, the battle of Armageddon is about to commence. The Anti-Pope, allying with the forces of evil, stands at the threshold of victory. Then, the man once known as Daniel Llanso rises out of the death destruction to become the new Hellspawn of this era. In a blind rage of memories from his own abused childhood, he saves two refugees, Madrid and Matthew from certain death at the hands of the Desiccator, by killing him. Even though Hellspawn just saved their lives, they feel only terror toward him while he seems very familiar to them.
name: Dark Future

description: Memory flashes of Daniel Llanso's past reveal few clues to his present situation as this future's Hellspawn. Madrid, frightened by witnessing the Hellspawn kill the Desiccator, turns her spinner on him and fires while Matthew recognizes him as his uncle. As they flee the area, they battle the Nightmares and manage to commandeer an Armored Personnel Carrier. Meanwhile, as the Hellspawn recovers from the blast, the demon, Abbadon initiates a genocidal mission. Elsewhere, the Anti-Pope visits the Nu-Vatican chambers where he guts a prisoner named Abel.
name: Blood Lust

description: Spawn is attacked from all sides and in his anger and confusion over his present state of being a warrior from Hell, destroys many humans while his cloak whispers encouragement. Flashbacks of his sister, Madrid, and his mom torment him. Meanwhile Madrid and Matthew reach a human enclave where they are taken to meet the spiritual leader, Montemeure, who orders them killed. They are saved by Abel and Dorro. After watching Daniel Llanso's reaction to his Hellish situation, Abaddon confers with Phelgethonyarre about Spawn's continued testing.
name: Corpse Candles

description: As Spawn races to rescue Madrid and Matthew, he is attacked by the demon chasing him, whom he eventually kills. Meanwhile, the Navkies attack the school. As Matthew runs to the auditorium, he is captured by Abel and taken to the tower. Madrid fights the Navkies with Siv and Flachette, and is saved by Spawn. After being expelled from the school, Madrid, Siv and Flechette race to the tower to save her son. Along the way, Bune attacks Spawn, only to be destroyed. At the tower, Spawn takes Matthew and warps him to his mother, and then kills Abaddon.
name: Damnation War

description:
Overview

John Mawbley is a serial killer certain he is cleansing society of its evil. When Gretchen Culver happens upon the carnage of Mawbley's crowd killing, she runs into traffic and is critically injured. She regains consciousness while being raped by the police and ambulance attendants, where she is beaten unconsciousness again. They deliver her to another serial killer for disposal. Meanwhile Sam and Twitch help their former police officers investigate still another murder case. When Twitch begins to question their career change, they land the missing persons case of Culver.
name: Suture

description:
Overview

Wayne Tannager seeks Sam & Twitch's help in locating his missing fiance, Gretchen Culver. Elsewhere, the police clear two more serial killer cases from their books when they find the killer sewn up by Suture's handiwork. Mawbley becomes Suture's next victim just as he intends to start a killing spree in a movie theatre. Meanwhile, Sam & Twitch trace Gretchen to an empty grave.
name: Blood And Rain

description: Sam & Twitch are warned off of the Culver case by NYPD Internal Affairs. They ignore the warning and look for the paramedics to question only to find them "sutured up". Later, across town, they "interview" Officer Kenny Osborne at gunpoint. Meanwhile, Jeremiah "Sharpie" Euden nearly claims another victim when Suture interrupts his work and kills him. Later, Sharpie's body makes an appearance.
name: Tombs

description: While Suture sits in jail, Sam & Twitch interrogate Osborne. Osborne confesses to what he and the others did to Gretchen Culver. In the interrogation room, Suture escapes and begins her rampage. At the station, Suture attacks the officers and follows Halliday and Deke as they leave the station, and steers their car into the East River. Halliday comes ashore to find Deke already strewn and sewn up, and becomes Suture's next victim. She is finally comforted by Sam & Twitch.
name: Carnival Of Souls

description: Angela has been commissioned by the survivors of the planet Pentagus-Fraser to destroy the evil ravaging their planet. At the center of the fight, Angela ferociously battles the arachnid beast Argus. She becomes distracted by the face of the mysterious Deurges long enough to become entangled in Argus’ web. After her capture the legend of Angela’s origin is revealed in flashbacks of the lives of the sacrificing souls that were blended to become the Heavenly warrior. In each case, the last thing they see is the dispassionate face of Deurges.
name: Limbo

description: The Argus explodes, activating the Kron and releasing Angela who is thrown into the "Foyer Oblivion". As the mysterious Deurges watches, Angela flashes back to Elysium and the Hall of Light where she confers with her mentor, Katherineal Triumvirate from fracturing.
name: A Fall of Doves

description: After attacking the Electro-storms and stopping them from consuming Earth, Angela is thrown into Limbo's core. She rescues a Heaven agent, Callindra and her clients, the Custers. Angela fights the demonoids & meets the anti-angel Lilith and Deurges. Angela clashes with Lilith, losing her Elysium-lock to Deurges. Angela and Lilith end up at the lifeless planet, Pentages-Fraser. In a rage, she tosses Lilith into the Argus, and swears vengeance on Deurges.
name: Cataclysm

description:
Jessica Priest's sociopathic personality is revealed in a flashback to her childhood, her living arrangements and demonstration of her abilities as a government assassin. Socially, Wynn gives Priest an assignment -- to recover a biogenetic weapon coded Heat-16 from a lab in Brazil. The mission turns deadly and Priest eliminates the security force, is captured and shot by the fraternal scientists, Liz Arno and Kevin Bergregor.

The life of the woman who killed Al Simmons, the man who first became Spawn. She started nasty and became much, much worse.
name: Codename: Priest

description: Jessica Priest is subjected to painful testing as the incestuous twins, Liz Arno and Kevin Bergregor, attempt to turn her into an experimental feral. When Priest escapes with their prized Heat-16 module, her former comrades are sent after her where they destroy the occupants of the nearby town of El Morte. Priest is captured by the guards of Erlich Westerlin, who recover the Heat-16 module and forces her into a life as a Uranium-235 miner.
name: Heart Of Darkness

description: After killing Aranxia, Westerlin brings Priest home. The ferals, programmed to retrieve the module, break into the compound, kill Westerlin and find the module. Priest incites the miners to overthrow the guards and follows the ferals through the jungle. She kills a feral, and follows the other back to the medlab just before Arno and Bergregor release the module's contents into the atmosphere. Priest kills both scientists and retrieves the module into the hands of Jason Wynn.
name: Apocalypse When

description: On a little known asteroid field at the Badlands Saloon and Grill, Poacher relates the story of how the First Angel, Abdiel was sentenced for a mission to penetrate Malebolgia's realm and terminate him. After Abdiel's mission briefing and initiation into a fallen angel's disguise, he is thrown into Hell. Once there, Smuggler eagerly volunteers to be Abdiel's guide to lead him to the Malebolgia. Along the way, Lilith, Grand Duchess of the Eighth Plane, tries to seduce him and is greeted with a brief but fierce battle which attracts the attention of the Malebolgia.
name: Sympathy For An Angel, Part 1

description: Abdiel has been undercover in Hell for six months. He is put in charge of gathering provisions for the welcoming of Al Simmons. He is told by Angel General Cheriour that the time to attack the Malebolgia is near. After being scorned by friends at Poacher's bar, he returns to Hell. During the arrival of Al Simmons, Abdiel is just about to attack Malebolgia when he is summoned back by Cheriour. Infuriated, he asks God if he is doing His will. With a resounding "NO" from God, he is cast into Hell, set up by the Malebolgia.
name: Sympathy For An Angel, Part 2

description: Mafia boss Twistelli experiences several hits. The first bomb, strapped to a small boy, killed several of Twistelli's friends at a wedding; an anti-aircraft gun destroyed the money laundering warehouse, the cell phone cloning operation and a restaurant. Twistelli calls the mob to find out who is after him and why no one will get involved. Jason Wynn gives Twistelli the news: he abused Overt-Kill, a prized plaything of an Italian godfather. Twistelli becomes a very dangerous man.
name: Twist Of Fate

description: Tony Twist learns about the people who destroyed his businesses and are after him. He then learns from a priest that the Vatican Secret Police are looking for someone in the Twistelli organization and will stop at nothing until they find him. The VSP is looking for someone who belongs to the ancient and ex-communicated order of the Knights of Templar. A man who has been sent to find and convert Spawn, the obsessive religious fanatic called The Curse.
name: Last Rites

description: The Curse meets Tony Twist in the sewer and gives him the name of Keene. Meanwhile Vincent D'Egallo, A Knight of Templar, is confronted by Cog, who warns him of potential doom. After Twist kills Keene, he tells The Curse where D'Egallo is located and is attacked. In his quest to obtain spiritual armor, The Curse captures D'Egallo and cuts him open. Twist escapes and returns to the sewer the same time the Neece does, and a fierce battle ensues. Twist and Neece survive, but D'Egallo & The Curse die.
name: Curse The Curse

description: Raenis, born the mortal Ariena and the God Cronus was happily living on an island of Centaurs when to rid the world of a future ruler. The new Hellspawn battles his way up from the underworld through the waters of Oceanus, determined to reign in place of Zeus and avenge the death of his father, himself and the Centaurs. Meanwhile, on Mt. Olympus, Zeus senses the threat of the new Hellspawn and prepares for the impending battle.
name: Dark Myth

description: After being told by Medusa that Zeus murdered his mortal mother Ariena, Raenis swears death to him. Zeus asks Hera to give herself to the monster Briareusin in exchange for its allegiance to Zeus. Raenis kills the monster and confronts Zeus. Raenis then defeats Zeus to become ruler with Medusa of the universe.
name: Chaos Cometh

description: After committing suicide, Ryan Hatchett finds himself on the flip side of Earth -- a zombie world ruled by Zombie Spawn. The Freak dubs Ryan's new name as Hatchet, Executioner Of The Dead, and then tells him his girlfriend Suzette is being sacrificed to the Zombie Spawn. Hatchet, rescuing Suzette, sees his new zombie form and runs away. Hatchet now must hone his skills from Zombie Spawn by killing other zombies.
name: Deadland

description: On loan from mafioso Don Bartino, Overt-Kill was destroyed in the alleys of New York City where he had been put to use by gangster Antonio Twistell. Dr. Eylan Hessman, Overt-Kill's creator, retrieves the remains of his robotic brother and vows to rebuild him. He exiles himself in a lab in northern Greenland where he secretly rebuilds a bigger and better robotic warrior he calls Overt War.
name: Overt-Resurrection

description: A retired Navy Captain, Jonathon Unger witness several government wrongs and collects the damning information. Armed with this information, the government tortures and imprisons him, but it can't break his resolve. After Overt-Kill murders his family and his fiancee', the government offers Unger a chance to kill him. While looking for Spawn in New York City, Unger is confronted by Overt-Kill. Telling Overt-Kill where he can find Spawn, Unger directs him to his former prison.
name: Overt-Hell

description: There is a demon in Harley, the Hellspawn Angel. After work, he is accosted by two thugs. Angel's desires finally surface and Harley kills both men, beginning the rampage. He then tracks down his friend who is on a date with Harley's dream girl, Kelly. The possessed Harley kills his friend and another couple while Kelly escapes. Arriving back at her house, she discovers Harley with her murdered parents. She is able to finally calm Harley while Angel schemes.
name: Heart Of Hell

description: FBI Consultant, Marc Simmons is transferred from Washington D.C. to NYC to help out on a case. He is the forensic psychologist brother of Al Simmons. The case is that of a viscous kidnapper and murderer called "The Crocodile". The case is also being monitored by Sam Burke & Twitch Williams.
name: Brother's Keeper

description: Dr. Marc Simmons (brother of Spawn) meets Damon Foster, ex-FBI agent turned impassioned (some say psychotic) hunter of serial killers. Foster is tracking the legendary killer, "Suture" and wants Marc's help in tracking her down. In return for helping, Foster said he will tell Simmons who butchered his wife and son. Unfortunately, Quinn kills him before he can give the information. The Crocodile Murder case is closed.
name: Return Of Suture, Part 1 - Ghosts

description: Well respected Dr. Ian Saunders counsels his patients in the office and on the radio. But Dr. Saunders has a heinous secret-skeletons in his closet. On the way home from his radio show he makes a stop at U-Stor-It. This place holds the good Dr.'s secrets-jars of heads-victim's of his murderous rage. His personal moment is interrupted by another killer, Suture. She knows his secret and threatens to expose him unless Dr. Saunders can cure her of her inner demons and a promise from him not to kill again. Unfortunately after giving Suture what she needed, his beloved wife is the one who ultimately turns him in and ends his reign of terror.
name: Return Of Suture, Part 2 - Bleed

description: Jonathon Edward Custer, the man who runs a little place known throughout history as: "Purgatory". In recent years this waiting room of repentance has fallen into disrepair, forgotten in this time of brutal cut and dry battles between Good and Evil; these days few souls are worthy of repentance. Jon Custer, bored, restless and afraid for his job, is about to change all that. He plans to make a dew disreputbale souls repent in his back-alley maze of redemption whether they like it or not.
name: Last Rites

description: Mayhem! Destruction! Panic in the streets! All of Manhattan is in peril as two amazons of unparalleled power duke it out in the streets! It's Titania vs. the She-Hulk in their biggest grudge match ever! And even if Jennifer can make it out in one piece­ will she be strong enough to deal with the secret that Reed Richards has been keeping from her all these years? Special guest star Doc Samson drops by to help with some gamma-powered emotional baggage. Part 2 of 3.
name: Imbalance of Power

description:
Titania part 3 of 3 and the end of this volume of She-Hulk. It returns in a new #1 issue some months later, still under writer Dan Slott.

"Acceptable Losses"

She-Hulk has NEVER been so broken, battered, and beaten. And if Titania gets her hands on her ONE more time, there won't be ANY coming back. Can special guest-stars Spider-Man, Hercules, and the Fantastic Four hold She-Hulk's worst enemy at bay? Or is this the end for Jen Walters and her emerald alter ego? Part 3 (of 3).
name: Some Disassembly Required

description: Still working against time to save the future of the Justice Society, Atom Smasher's meeting with the Atom doesn't go as planned, while Stargirl is forced to take drastic measures to help Starman. Plus, Degaton's ultimate plan is uncovered.
name: JSA/JSA, Chapter IV: Past Mistakes

description: The teams come together to stop Degaton's horrible plans. But what "secret weapon" must they face, and how will the JSA of tomorrow help save the JSA of yesterday?
name: JSA/JSA

description:
The JSA convenes a special meeting to decide the fate of Atom-Smasher. Sand vouches for letting him back onto the team, but several others, including Sentinel and Hourman are reluctant to consider the idea in lieu of Al's actions in Kahndaq. They collectively decide to put the matter to a vote.

Meanwhile in Midway City, the mysterious Crimson Avenger appears and prepares to mete out justice against a man who murdered his wife. Before she can exact justice however, the untethered spirit of vengeance the Spectre appears in the room. He kills the Avenger's target then turns his attention on the Avenger herself. Suddenly, a beam of purple energy shoots through her shoulder. The origin of this beam of light is Jean Loring, who only recently took on the power of Eclipso.

In Kahndaq, Black Adam has a video conference with Lex Luthor. He reminds him that the only reason he associated with his Society was because Luthor agreed to keep his people away from Kahndaq. Adam warns Luthor to make certain that he honors his end of the deal.

In Fawcett City, Billy and Mary Batson climb the steps of their school. Billy suddenly sees the reflection of Shazam in a window. Shazam summons Billy to the Rock of Eternity. He tells Billy about the merging of Jean Loring's body with that of Eclipso. He also points him in the right direction of Eclipso's next target. As Captain Marvel, Billy decides to enlist the aid of his old allies the JSA.

Black Adam meanwhile, flies to the U.S. and comes to Atom-Smasher's room. Al is patiently waiting for his former teammates to come to a decision. Adam tells him that the people of Kahndaq needs his help. Al agrees to accompany him back to Kahndaq.

The JSA members, having finalized their decision on whether to accept Al back on the team go to his room. Al is gone, but floating outside his window is Hawkman and Captain Marvel. They tell the JSA that they must go to Kahndaq.

-Source
name: Black Vengeance, Part 1

description:
Two Days Ago:

The Spectre continues on his mad quest to destroy all magic on Earth. He appears in the middle of the Tower of Fate in Salem and confronts Hector Hall. Hector dons the Helmet of Nabu, but he is not fast enough. The Spectre violently attacks Hector and his wife Lyta.

Today:

Black Adam takes Atom-Smasher with him back to Kahndaq. The Spetre has already arrived and is burning the capitol city of Shiruta to the ground. Black Adam's loyal Feitheran warriors swarm the Spectre, but with a wave of his hand he turns a phalanx of Feitherans into stone. Northwind, having evaded the Spectre's first attack strikes him across the face with his spear. Black Adam flies down and plows through the Spectre's midsection. The attack gives the Spectre pause, but he manages to drain away the power that gives Black Adam his strength. Transforming back into a mortal, he falls until caught by the giant Atom-Smasher.

The JSA finally arrive in Kahndaq aboard the Steel Eagle. They immediately begin attending the endangered Kahndaqi citizens. Black Adam speaks the magic word "Shazam" and regains his strength and vitality. He turns against the JSA despite the fact that they are here to help him. He tells them that the people of Kahndaq do not want their assistance. Adam begins fighting Power Girl and during the fight Power Girl's eyes begin to glow. She is suddenly struck blind for an unknown reason. By reflex, she unleashes a powerful burst of heat vision that sends Black Adam reeling.

Mister Terrific meanwhile instructs J.J. Thunder to release the Thunderbolt. Johnny Thunderbolt bursts out of the pen and J.J. tells him to teleport the Spectre to the Fifth Dimension. The Thunderbolt is no match for the Spectre's raw power though and the Spectre sends the Thunderbolt power along with J.J. Thunder back into the Fifth Dimension.

Meanwhile, Eclipso finally makes her presence known. She creates stone effigies of the late heroes Alexander Montez and Nemesis and has them attack Stargirl. Atom-Smasher look on in horror as one of the stone golems grasps Stargirl by the throat.

-Source
name: Black Vengeance Part 2

description:
While the Spectre continues his rampage across Shiruta, Eclipso animates two stone statues and has them attack Stargirl and Atom-Smasher. Stargirl manages to wrestle free of their grasp and recovers her cosmic staff. Atom-Smasher then makes short work of both statues. He gets the drop on Eclipso and steps on her, threatening to apply lethal pressure unless she tells him how to call of the Spectre. Eclipso taunts him then releases a blast of energy that drives Atom-Smasher back.

Meanwhile, a panicking Power Girl is still stumbling around blind in a crowd of angry Kahndaqi citizens. Hawkgirl swoops down and pulls Kara to safety, but Eclipso leaps on top of her and begins raking her back with her sharp talons. Hawkgirl uses her spear and rams into Eclipso's eye. Black Adam approaches them and grabs Eclipso. Enraged and with no remorse in his heart, he snaps Eclipso's neck and lets her fall to the ground. Jean survives however and after snapping her neck back into place decides to flee the battle scene.

Atom-Smasher meanwhile decides to confront the Spectre directly. He increases his size and mass well beyond safe limits and tackles him head-on. Al bargains with the Spectre and tells him that he will offer himself up to the Spectre's judgment and subsequent vengeance if the Spectre leaves Kahndaq. The Spectre agrees and plunges his wraithly fist into Atom-Smasher's chest. He judges him for his deliberate actions that led to the death of Extant. His fist crushes Al's heart and the former JSA member falls to the ground. The Spectre, honoring his promise, disappears from Kahndaq. For an instant, Per Degaton appears before Al's broken and dying body and says, "I told you I'd watch your heart burst with sin". Stargirl spots him and begins hurling her starburts, but Per Degaton disappears back into the timestream. The other JSA members quickly crowd around Al's body, but there is nothing they can do. Atom-Smasher is dead. Black Adam, refusing to see his ally die, calls down the power of the magic lightning. Twin bolts strike down upon Atom-Smasher's chest where Black Bolt is standing and the shock is strong enough to restart his over-sized heart. Sentinel creates an energy craft to carry Al away and Hawkman tells Black Adam that they are taking him home.

-Source
name: Black Vengeance: Conclusion

description: Featuring guest art by David Lopez & Fernando Blanco (FALLEN ANGEL)! In the aftermath of the devastating "Black Vengeance" story, the JSA must regroup and reassess their purpose - but Hawkman harbors a secret that will change the JSA's role in the DCU forever! Plus, Mr. Terrific begins his hunt for Roulette!
name: In Search Of...

description: Alan Scott pays a visit to Hal Jordan as Hal prepares to leave Earth with Donna Troy. But Alan has one last favor to ask Hal, and it will be one of the hardest things a Green Lantern has ever tried to accomplish!
name: Mixed Signals

description: A DAY OF VENGEANCE tie-in! The JSA desperately seeks Dr. Fate to help them find the missing Jakeem and Thunderbolt. Meanwhile, as the Spectre's rampage continues, the team's greatest enemy has found the opening he needs to destroy the JSA once and for all!
name: Lost & Found: Part One of Three

description: A DAY OF VENGEANCE tie-in! Amid the ruins of Dr. Fate's tower, one half of the JSA fight for their lives against Mordru, free from his imprisonment in the Rock of Eternity. Meanwhile, the rest of the JSA battle to save the Fifth Dimension from the iron grip of...Jakeem Thunder!
name: Lost & Found: Part Two of Three

description: The final battle between Mordru and Dr. Fate rages to its shocking conclusion through the worlds of Kingdom Come and JUSTICE LEAGUE: THE NAIL! Plus, the Thunderbolt vs. Jakeem to decide the ultimate fate of the Fifth Dimension! After this issue, two members of the JSA will never be seen again!
name: Lost & Found: Part Three of Three

description: As Robin continues to battle the Dark Rider through the streets of Bludhaven, back in Gotham Bruce and Alfred discuss the events that led to Tim's relocation and solo career. As Robin is able to take down the Dark Rider, the Penguin is forever after his head. Also Tim's uncle arrives in town.
name: A Rider on the Storm

description: As Robin goes on by his new life with his secret uncle, he pays a visit to Rising Sun Archer, only to find her tied up with a message directed to him. Also Johnny Warlock wakes a new unkown threat.
name: A Gift From a Friend

description:
Robin captures Penguin and begins an interrogation, obviously the Penguin wasn't letting any information out, then he was saved by his goons, Robin let them all go. But suddenly a new figure appears, Robins begins an attack without letting the strange person to explain, he assured that he was an ally not an enemy, but Robin didn't believed him. This man s later revealed to be Veteran. After, Robin was beaten up and taken to his hideout.

In the mean time Bruce appeared in Bludhaven and confronted Tim's uncle, he discovered that he was actually an actor hired by Tim.

Robin went to the Gotham to use the cave's computer into looking this new threat and hopefully finding him, when Bruce arrived he didn't seem interested in talking about this enemy, as he was in talking about Tim's "uncle"
name: The Freelance Doctrine

description: When Batman realizes that Eddie Drake isn't really Tim's Uncle, he expresses pride in the young man.  As Robin continues his crusade in Bludhaven, Batman confronts Alfred about visiting Mrs. Drake.  As Robin is seemingly ambushed by villains, it is revealed that he is the target of recruitment by patriotic superheroes!
name: Meaner Than a Junkyard Dog

description: As Robin thinks about The Veteran offer to join his army Darla Aquista makes a return with a very dark secret.
name: Veteran Affairs

description: Darla Aquista who was supposed to be dead, is back and with a secret. She is supposed to kill Robin in order to exact vengeance for Johnny Warlock. Tim Drake helps her to find Robin, and develops a plan where he made Superboy to dress as Robin so she would believe that the Robin she was looking for is not Robin anymore. When Conner appeared Darla attacked him with newly aquired magic powers and believing she killed Robin.
name: Good Girls Don't Die

description: As Robin jumps out of a plane into the middle of a battle with Zombie killers, he continues to fight with the Patriotic heroes.  Robin eventually helps the members of the unit to survive, earning him a kiss from a very appreciative Lieutenant.  Before he is able to respond about whether or not he will be their new recruit, he informs them that he has to first speak with the Batman.
name: Officer Candidate

description: In an OMAC Project Tie-in, Tim returns to Bludhaven, which is under attack.  Tim is soon targeted by the OMAC's but is able to hold them off as he soon has to confront Johnny Warlock.  He easily defeats him and appreciates the Sergeants help with the clean-up process that is about to get underway.
name: Rock the Haven

description:
An OMAC Project Tie-in.
While Robin continues to help with the clean-up of Bludhaven after the OMACs have wrecked havoc through the city, Robin encounters some villains and takes them down with the help of his allies.  Towards the end Tim is soon surrounded by far too many villains than he, or his allies can handle at the present time.
name: Days of Fire and Madness

description: Blüdhaven is filled with metahuman villians, recently freed from their OMAC captors. Can Robin, the Veteran and the Shadowpact keep the city from falling into chaos?
name: Too Many Villians

description: PART 1 (OF 6) From the ashes of the Avengers a new group of heroes spring forth -- all of whom happen to be FORMER VILLAINS! This new ongoing series signals a return to greatness for one of Marvel's longest-running titles of the last decade! And it may look all-new, but longtime fans can relax -- these are the same creative schlubs who brought you the rollicking Avengers/Thunderbolts Limited Series!
name: One Step Forward

description: PART 2 (OF 6) From the ashes of the Avengers a new group of heroes spring forth -- all of whom happen to be FORMER VILLAINS! This new ongoing series signals a return to greatness for one of Marvel's longest-running titles of the last decade! And it may look all-new, but longtime fans can relax -- these are the same creative schlubs who brought you the rollicking Avengers/Thunderbolts Limited Series!
name: The Games People Play

description: PART 3 (OF 6) After last month's explosive conclusion, the United Nations building is going to collapse -- unless the new Thunderbolts trapped inside are willing to risk their lives to stop it. Does this new team have the backbone to support the hopes and dreams of an entire city? Guest-starring Spider-Man, who knows a thing or two about heavy burdens! Meanwhile, Fathom 5 strikes again! Baron Strucker gets the point! Our final team member makes a radioactive entrance! And we debut the All-New... no, that would be telling...
name: Heavy Burdens

description: PART 4 (OF 6) "Enemy of the State" Crossover with Wolverine.Wolverine scours New York City in search of Baron Wolfgang Von Strucker! Is this related to the dynamic debut of the new Sw­ ... wait, that¹s a secret! Here¹s what we can tell you. The New Thunderbolts are caught in the middle of a HYDRA civil war and one of them is trying to hide complicity in a murder. Another is trying to see Joystick naked. And all of them are keeping their distance from the team's newest member ­ Radioactive Man! I mean, dude, if the skirt and glowing green skin weren't a bit of a scare, the name sure is...
name: Sword and Claw

description: PART 5 (OF 6) FATHOM 5 launches an all-out terrorist assault on the city! With SONGBIRD in the hospital and MACH IV without an armor (or is an OLD one available?), what will ATLAS do? Who can save the day? Would you believe... HYDRA?!! And while all this hits the fans, will ATLAS keep his cool? Will RADIOACTIVE MAN blow his top? And will the other T-Bolts spring into action... or sit in a Brooklyn bar and watch Manhattan sink into the river on CNN?
name: Call to Battle

description: PART 6 (OF 6) The climactic confrontation between the new Thunderbolts and Hydra! But how can the new T-Bolts become "Earth's Mightiest Heroes" if half the team would rather sit the fight out in a bar? Plus: Strucker's secrets are revealed! A dirty deal is made to save Manhattan! And the dramatic return of -- Photon? Crunchy continuity goodness in the Mighty Marvel Manner!
name: City of Heroes

description: Flushed with success, the Big Apple's newest heroes have to face their greatest challenge yet: an adoring public and the reflections in their mirrors! A new storyarc begins with a self-contained jumping-on point: "Modern Marvels," shows how the "man on the street" views the T-Bolts -- and if that matches how the T-Bolts view themselves...
name: Modern Marvels

description:
An old friend asks SPEED DEMON to pull off a huge heist -- will he do it? And does BLIZZARD want to stop him -- or get in on the action? Meanwhile, PHOTON tries very, very hard to remember why he should be mad at ATLAS. RADIOACTIVE MAN gets -- a publicist? And a resignation threatens to tear the team apart before it's even come together!

Note: Marcus Stone is not depicted in art but his voice is heard.
name: A Shock to the System

description:
Everyone in Atlantis is dying and only one man can save them -- the person responsible for their poisoning! Which T-Bolt was willing to kill thousands of people -- and is unwilling to stop the carnage?

Also, Photon vs. Photon in a battle you won't believe! And... what's up with Songbird's new boyfriend... he looks a little... purple...
name: The T-Bolts vs. The Sub-Mariner

description: Everything you thought you knew could very well be WRONG! Songbird and Swordsman are on the run with all of Manhattan against them -- but when they reach the Thunderbolts, will they find friends or foes? Have Songbird's former teammates been manipulated from the very beginning by -- Killgrave the Purple Man?
name: Of Mice and Maze

description:
Something is desperately wrong with the HOUSE of M and only Private Genis-Vell, a member of the Titan/Kree Exploratory Council, can see it. Why does he keep having visions of people who wanted to hurt him... ? What happens when he realizes the only way to keep his mind from coming apart is for him to destroy an entire world?

Days ago, the Kree Exploratory Armada Arrived on Earth to renew a longstanding alliance between the worlds, ties forged after the sacrifice made by Captain Mar-Vell, the Kree hero who fought alongside Magneto and Earth's heroes in the Kree / Skrull Wars.

Part of the delegation is Mar-Vell's son, Private Genis-Vell, who is making his first visit to Eath and facing the burdens of expectation borne by all children of great heroes.

Meanwhile, in an effort to show their support, the Kree have helped Captain Marvel track down the Thunderbolts, outlaw super-villains who have come to call themselves "freedom fighters against the genetic tyranny of the House of Magnus".
name: House of M

description: The Conclusion of PURPLE REIGN -- 1/3 of the team is hospitalized -- 1/3 of the team is AWOL and 1/3 of the team has to fight the maniacal manipulations of Killgrave the Purple Man -- if they can avoid fighting each other first! Half of everything you think you know hits the fan and when we find out Purple Man's big secret, the other half hits it, too!
name: Living Lies

description: What evil lurks in the brackish waters of the swamp? It's the return of one of Marvel's all-time favorite horror characters: Man-Thing! Just in time for the upcoming theatrical film release by Lion's Gate Films, this three-issue movie "prequel" is written by Hans Rodionoff, screenwriter for the Man-Thing film, and drawn by "master of the macabre" Kyle Hotz (The Hood). Set in the Bywater Swamp from the Man-Thing film, this self- contained story will enhance the movie-going experience with BRAND-NEW content we found lurking in the shadows of the bayou!
name: Whatever Knows Fear: Part 1

description: Sinister events continue to mount in the creepy town of Bywater, Louisiana, where an outsider has arrived to uncover the horrifying truth of what lurks in the swamp. Featuring all-new, original content and set in the world of the film.
name: Whatever Knows Fear: Part 2

description: The Man-Thing movie prequel concludes with a horrific showdown with Man-Thing as you've never seen it before. Check out an incarnation of Man-Thing too wild to make it into the film! The wrath of nature explodes in Bywater, Louisiana...will the mysterious newcomer make it out alive? Featuring all-new, original content and set in the world of the film, penned by the team of macabre master Kyle Hotz and Man-Thing screenwriter Hans Rodionoff.
name: "Whatever Knows Fear..." Conclusion

description:
Whether she's going to school or hanging out with her friends at the Coffee Bean, Mary Jane Watson is always the life of the party. But what no one knows is that this gorgeous redhead's exuberant personality is a shell designed to make her forget about life's harsh realities. From her social life to her undying interest in becoming an actress to her crush on that costumed crime-fighter who swings along the New York City rooftops, it's clear that Mary Jane just wants to escape. Join MJ, Harry Osborn, Liz Allan, Flash Thompson and Harry's nerdy friend, Peter Parker, as they experience the thrilling highs and the crushing lows of high-school existence!

Queens, New York.

Liz Allan is trying to convince Mary Jane to go to the Homecoming Dance with Harry Osborn. Mary Jane protests, and says that Harry is like a brother to her and that she's looking for something more exciting. Liz tells Mary Jane that she's being unrealistic, but MJ already has someone in mind. As Mary Jane is called down to dinner, we get a glimpse of her bedroom wall which is covered in photos of Spiderman.

The next day in school, Liz Allan rushes up to MJ, complaining about her boyfriend Flash. Liz is extremely excited about the Homecoming Dance and really wants to be Queen, with Flash as her King. Flash, unfortunately, doesn't share the same ambitions.

Liz tells MJ that Flash missed the deadline for signing up, but that she managed to pull some strings and get him in. After she's done ranting, Liz begs MJ to reconsider going with Harry, so that they can all double date. Liz, MJ, Flash and Harry have known each other since they were children.

Just as Liz leaves, Harry pops up behind MJ, scaring her. Harry asks MJ if she's running for Homecoming Queen, and is relieved when she says no, fearing that it would drive a wedge between the four friends.

After school the four meet at a cafe, the Coffee Bean. Peter Parker approaches Harry, and asks him if they're still doing their science project together. Flash insults Peter, telling him to get a life. Flash asks MJ who she's going to the Homecoming Dance with, and Liz whisks him away, leaving MJ and Harry alone to talk. Harry gets up and goes over to Peter's table, where he consoles the insulted Parker. Impressed with his sensitive ways, MJ asks Harry out to dinner.

In gym class, while playing badminton, MJ spills the beans to Liz, who is absolutely ecstatic. Liz is happy that her friend has finally stopped fantasizing about Spiderman.

Friday Night.

Harry takes MJ to an expensive restaurant, where she feels awkward and underdressed. The menu is in french, and MJ is overwhelmed, but Harry says he's been to this restaurant many times before and orders for both of them.

After the restaurant, Harry takes MJ on a carriage ride through Central Park and the two reminisce about their childhood. Harry tells MJ that he never wants to hide anything from her, and wants to tell her everything. Mary Jane becomes uncomfortable and decides to go home.

Suddenly, the back of the subway car MJ is in bursts open and she is almost sucked out. MJ holds on and dangles out of the back as Electro and Spiderman tussle inside the car. Just as MJ loses her grip, she is saved by Spiderman. Spiderman disables Electro and takes MJ home, dropping her right outside her house. MJ asks Spidey how he knew where she lived, leaving Spiderman to give an awkward excuse and swing away.

The next day at the Coffee Bean, MJ tells Liz all about her brush with death. Liz, however, is more interested in how MJ's date with Harry went. MJ says that she doesn't feel like Harry is the right guy for her, and says that she'd really like to go to Homecoming with Spiderman.
name: The Real Thing

description:
They say money makes the world go 'round. Mary Jane Watson doesn't know who "they" are, but she sure wishes "they" would help her to become financially independent!

The Manhattan Bridge.

New York.

Riding into town on the subway, Mary Jane keeps an eye out for Spider-Man.

MJ meets Liz at the mall, where the two shop for Homecoming dresses. Liz picks out dress after dress, but MJ's heart just into in it. MJ laments that she's been looking everywhere for Spider-Man, but she just can't find him and she doesn't want to go to Homecoming alone. Liz flips out at MJ, telling her to forget about Spidey and focus on Harry, but MJ says she only thinks of Harry as a friend.

That night, Harry takes MJ out. The two sit on a bench on a quay and talk. Harry is about to ask MJ to Homecoming when she interrupts him and manages to change the subject. Later, Mary Jane becomes annoyed at the fact that Harry is paying for everything - dinner, movie, cabs and snacks - and decides that she needs to get a job.

MJ gets a job at the Happy Happy Hippo, a fast-food burger joint, but struggles. She messes up orders and is simply overwhelmed by all of the customers. MJ is so tired out by her job that she starts falling asleep in school, and her grades are slipping because of it.

At the Coffee Bean, Harry and Flash discuss Mary Jane. Harry tells Flash that he thinks that everything is going great with MJ, but even he has some doubts. Peter walks by, and is once again accosted by Flash. Liz and MJ soon join the two buddies, and they all tell MJ that she's working too hard and that she should quit. MJ tells them she can't, because she's getting her first paycheck that night.

The paycheck, however, is a complete disappointment and MJ quits, deciding to try other jobs. MJ works in a video store, as a waitress, a receptionist and even a cleaning lady but messes up every time.

Later, at a movie with Harry, MJ falls asleep. Harry prods her awake, and tells her that she's working too hard and doesn't have to, because he's willing and able to pay for everything. MJ says she's hopeful that she'll find the perfect job, and is distracted by a poster of Spider-Man in a bus shelter. Harry looks on sadly as MJ stares at her idol.

At school the next day, MJ is sent to the guidance counsellor, who is worried about her grades and how tired she constantly is. The counsellor tells her that other students are working 40-hours a week to keep a roof over their heads and food in their bellies, and asks MJ what she's working for. MJ reveals that she wants money so that she can do things with her friends without feeling like a burden, but that she's given up on finding a good job.

At the mall, Mary Jane gazes longingly at the dress she had picked out for Homecoming. A salesperson asks her if she would like to try it on, but MJ tells her she can't afford it. The woman tells her that one of her staff is on maternity leave, and gives MJ a job that she guarantees will get her the dress and more. MJ accepts happily.
name: The Money Thing

description:
When some classmates play a prank on Mary Jane, good guy Flash Thompson goes on the offensive! Will he get himself suspended from the football team, or can MJ and Liz convince Flash to sit this one out?

Mary Jane, Liz Allan, Flash Thompson and Harry Osborn are once again hanging out in their favourite booth at the Coffee Bean. MJ spots a couple of classmates who have been pulling pranks on her and hopes they don't see her.

MJ tells her friends that the boys saran-wrapped her desk, rigged her locker to bathe her in confetti, dangled a rubber tarantula over her head as she walked and put a whoopee cushion on her seat during class - and "that's the highlight reel." This really gets Flash riled up, and he's ready to fight the bullies. Liz stops him, but Flash is still angry.

Liz and MJ grab lunch in the mall food court, and talk about the boys. Liz tells MJ that Flash is as loyal as they come, and was looking out for MJ like a sister. Liz asks MJ about Harry, and MJ reveals that although Harry's a great guy and she should be head over heels in love with him, she can't stop thinking about Spider-Man.
name: The Loyalty Thing

description:
Liz Allan is sure Flash is cheating on her! If she can't trust her best friend Mary Jane to help her dig up the dirt, who can she trust?

Mary Jane oversleeps and is late for school. When she gets there, she spots Spider-Man sneaking out of a second storey window, and asks the web-slinger what he's doing there. Spider-Man tries to leave, but MJ tells him that she's been looking for him since he saved her that night in the subway. MJ asks Spidey to the Homecoming Dance, and demands that he tells her who he is. Spidey says no to both and leaves to foil a bank robbery.

Spoilers

At school it is obvious that Harry thinks he and MJ are now a couple. Harry goes to kiss MJ, and she ducks. When the kiss finally happens, Harry is happy, but MJ is left feeling awkward.

Liz meets MJ at her locker and calls her and Harry lovebirds, but MJ is too preoccupied with her crush on Spider-Man. Liz explodes and tells Mary Jane that she needs to stop being infatuated with Spider-Man when she's already got Harry. Liz tells MJ not to be like Flash, who she believes is cheating on her with another girl, or at least crushing on someone else. Liz enlists MJ to help her find out who and MJ agrees, though she already secretly knows that she is the object of Flash's affection.

Flash finds MJ at her locker and asks her to help him study history that night at the library, and MJ awkwardly agrees. At the library, Flash goes on about how much he appreciates MJ for standing up for him when Liz calls him stupid, and MJ tries to shake off the compliments, saying that's what friends are for. Just as the situation gets really awkward, MJ tells Flash she forgot about something she promised to do with her mom and escapes.

The next day Liz confronts MJ about her study date, and asks if she found out who Flash is crushing on. MJ says that she doesn't know, and asks Liz not to confront him about it. Liz reveals to Mary Jane that she's been going through all of Flash's things, but with no luck.

That night at the football game, Liz spots Flash talking to a rival cheerleader and goes berserk, attacking the girl. Flash stops her and Liz tells him that she knows he's trying to replace her, before running off.

MJ finds Liz in the changing room, and tells her that she'll handle the situation with Flash. A grateful Liz tells MJ that she's the only friend she has left, and MJ feels even guiltier and guiltier.

After the game, Flash and MJ sit on the steps of the school and talk. MJ tells Flash that Liz didn't mean it, and that though she makes fun of him she really does love him. Flash says he understands, and is happy that Liz is in love with him. Flash and MJ hug. Liz walks by at just this moment, and misinterprets the entire thing.
name: The Trust Thing

description:
The first issue proper of the series comes in four variants, detailing certain events from the four characters' perspectives. While around half of the story is the same in each version, there are two segments unique to each character/variant.

Dusk's body is discovered by both the police and Spider-Man, the latter of whom is disturbed to find a young woman dead and in the guise of an identity he once assumed. He resolves to investigate the girl's death, and the source of the Slinger's costumes.
Ricochet and Hornet talk over the phone both clearly shaken by Dusk's death. The story then spilts as each of the characters handle a local threat , converges again as the boys meet to discuss Dusk's death, then diverges again as they attempt to stop a train crash engineered by a sick, suicidal railroad worker, each issue depicting the rescue attempt from that character's perspective, with exception of Dusk who arrives too late to aid in averting the disaster, but manages to save a young boy in the aftermath.
The common part of the issues begins again as Prodigy visits the Slinger's mentor, the golden age hero, the Black Marvel.
name: So Whose Idea Was This Anyway?

description:
Anxious to determine the circumstances of Dusk's death, and why four strangers have taken up superhero identities that he created, Spider-Man chases Ricochet, but loses him.
.
Ricochet, Hornet and Prodigy investigate an old hotel being renovated by the criminal organization, the Maggia. Prodigy spies on the local Maggia mob boss, while the others investigate the tunnels that run under the hotel. Elsewhere, Dusk visits her home and continues to contemplate what has happened to her since her death.

Ricochet and Hornet discover the Maggia dumping barrels of a mysterious chemical, but are attacked by mutated rats before they can take things any further. When they attempt to contact Prodigy for help they inadvertently alert the Maggia to his presence. Though he escapes, his operation is ruined and he abandons his teamates in anger as the tunnel they're in collapses, trapping Ricochet.
name: Hooligans

description:
Dusk rescues Hornet, but departs while he's too disorientated to identify her. Ricochet and Hornet try to make sense of recent events, but are interrupted by Spider-Man's arrival. As the Slingers attempt to flee and Spider-Man gives chase, they accidentally trigger a traffic accident. Banding together the three prevent anyone from being hurt and Spider-man warns his younger cohorts that being a superhero can't be taken lightly. However, they depart before he can ask them any questions.
Once home, Hornet decides to investigate the hotel that the Maggia is renovating, and its connection to the Black Marvel. He is greatly disturbed by a visit from Dusk, their first genuine contact since her death.
Back at the Black Marvel's quarters, he reassures Prodigy that abandoning his teammates was the right choice, as their inadequacy would only hold him back.
name: With Friends Like These...

description:
Events come to a head at the Royal Grand Hotel. Inside the building, the Black Marvel attends to his own agenda while Ricochet and Hornet clash with Prodigy outside. Hornet has uncovered that the Black Marvel tried to save people from a fire that burned the hotel down in his youth, but failed, and now Ricochet and Hornet are worried by what he might be planning.
Dusk confronts Spider-Man, and asks him to leave her and her teammates alone. She teleports to the hotel as Prodigy begins to question why his mentor brought him to the hotel, and the Black Marvel makes his move.
name: The Black Marvel Strikes!

description:
The Slingers confront their mentor, the Black Marvel, as they realize that he's responsible for the fire engulfing the hotel. Hornet and Dusk set about getting people to safety, while Ricochet rescues his girlfriend from a mentally deteriorating Black Marvel, and Prodigy learns what it really means to be a superhero.
At his home, Spider-Man examines the Slingers costumes that he once wore, and decides to let the issue rest.
name: Good-Bye to the Golden Age

description: Ricochet, Hornet and Dusk meet to reflect on recent events, how they came to be recruited by the Black Marvel, and what they plan to do in future. During this, Dusk subjects her teammates to a test of trust, and reveals a potential love-triangle within the group.
name: Truth, Consequenses, Dares & Dysfunction

description: Hornet is abducted by the Griz, a rat-like humanoid who controls the mutated rats which appeared earlier in the series, and has a vendetta against Hornet. Ricochet and Dusk attempt a rescue, while Prodigy returns to his home.
name: Revenge of The Griz, Part 1

description: The Griz reveals his origins, as well as his reason for hating Hornet. As the other Slingers prevent the Griz from poisoning the city's water supply and killing Eddie, Prodigy attempts to embark upon his own superhero career without the aid of his full powers, but runs into difficulty.
name: Revenge of The Griz, Part 2

description: Johnny Gallo was a mutant way before he became Ricochet. And we all know mutants are ripe targets for the deranged Nanny and her deadly Orphan Maker! And when they set their sites on adding Johnny to their fold, everyone he holds dear are drawn into the line of fire!
name: Looze Endz And Lozt Boyz
